00088     //  ----------------------------------------------------
00089 
00090     extern void  FastInverse (  int N, rmatrix A, ivector J0,
00091     //#D                          realtype &  Det,
00092                                 int & Signal );
00093     //
00094     //      13.09.90  <--  Last Modification Date
00095     //                    ------------------------
00096     //
00097     // ================================================
00098     //
00099     //        Fast Inversion of the matrix  A
00100     //      by the method of  GAUSS - JORDAN  .
00101     //
00102     // ------------------------------------------------
00103     //
00104     //          Input  parameters  are  :
00105     //
00106     //     N   -   dimension of the matrix
00107     //     A   -   the matrix [1..N][1..N] to be inverted.
00108     // ------------------------------------------------
00109     //
00110     //     J0  -   integer vector [1..N] for temporal storage
00111     //
00112     // ------------------------------------------------
00113     //
00114     //          Output parameters  are  :
00115     //
00116     //     A   -   the inverted matrix
00117     //     Signal - the error key :
00118     //            = 0   <=>   O'K
00119     //             else
00120     //            degeneration was found, and
00121     //            the rang of matrix is  Signal-1.
00122     //
00123     //        Variable  Det  may return the determinant
00124     //     of matrix A.  To obtain it, remove all comments
00125     //     of form  //#D.
00126     //
00127     // ================================================
00128 
00129 
00130     //  ----------------------------------------------------
00131 
00132     extern void  SVD ( int    NA,  int     M,    int N,
00133                        rmatrix A,  rmatrix U,    rmatrix V,
00134                        rvector W,  rvector RV1,
00135                        bool MatU,  bool   MatV,
00136                        int & RetCode );
00137     //
00138     //      13.12.01  <--  Last Modification Date
00139     //                    ------------------------
00140     //
00141     // ================================================
00142     //
00143     //         The    Singular Value Decomposition
00144     //    of the matrix  A  by the algorithm from
00145     //      G.Forsait, M.Malkolm, K.Mouler.  Numerical
00146     //    methods of mathematical calculations //
00147     //    M., Mir, 1980.
00148     //
00149     //         Matrix  A  is represented as
00150     //
00151     //         A  =  U * W * VT
00152     //
00153     // ------------------------------------------------
00154     //
00155     //  All dimensions are indexed from 1 on.
00156     //
00157     // ------------------------------------------------
00158     //
00159     //         Input  parameters:
00160     //
00161     //     NA  -   number of lines in A. NA may be
00162     //           equal to M or N  only.  If NA=M
00163     //           then usual SVD will be made. If MA=N
00164     //           then matrix A is transposed before
00165     //           the decomposition, and the meaning of
00166     //           output parameters  U  and  V  is
00167     //           swapped (U accepts VT and VT accepts U).
00168     //           In other words, matrix  A  has physical
00169     //           dimension of  M x N , same as U and V;
00170     //           however the logical dimension of it
00171     //           remains that of  N x M .
00172     //     M   -   number of lines in  U
00173     //     N   -   number of columns in  U,V and length
00174     //           of  W,RV1 .  Always provide  M >= N  !
00175     //     A   -   matrix [1..M][1..N] or [1..N][1..M]
00176     //           to be decomposed. The matrix does not
00177     //           change,  and it may coincide with  U  or
00178     //           V, if NA=M (in which case  A  does change)
00179     //     MatU -  compute  U , if set True
00180     //     MatV -  compute  V , if set True
00181     //     RV1  -  temporary array [1..N].
00182     //     U    - should be always supplied as an array of
00183     //            [1..M][1..N], M>=N .
00184     //     V    - should be suuplied as an array of
00185     //            [1..N][1..N] if MatV is True .
00186     //
00187     // ------------------------------------------------
00188     //
00189     //          Output parameters  are  :
00190     //
00191     //     W   -   N non-ordered singular values,
00192     //           if  RetCode=0. If RetCode<>0, the
00193     //           RetCode+1 ... N -th values are still
00194     //           valid
00195     //     U   -   matrix of right singular vectors
00196     //           (arranged in columns),  corresponding
00197     //           to the singular values in  W,  if
00198     //           RetCode=0 and MatU is True.  If MatU
00199     //           is False, U  is still used as a
00200     //           temporary array. If RetCode<>0 then
00201     //           the  RetCode+1 ... N -th vectors
00202     //           are  valid
00203     //     V   -   matrix of left singular vectors
00204     //           (arranged in columns),  corresponding
00205     //           to the singular values in  W,  if
00206     //           RetCode=0 and MatV is True. If MatV
00207     //           is False, V is not used and may be set
00208     //           to NULL. If RetCode<>0 then the
00209     //           RetCode+1 ... N -th vectors are valid
00210     //     RetCode - the error key :
00211     //            = 0   <=>   O'K
00212     //              else
00213     //            = k, if the k-th singular value
00214     //                 was not computed after 30 iterations.
00215     //
00216     // ------------------------------------------------
00217     //
00218     //          Key  Variables  are  :
00219     //
00220     //     ItnLimit  -  the limit for iterations
00221     //
00222     //     This routine does not use any machine-dependent
00223     //  constants.
00224     //
00225     // ================================================
00226     //
00227     //
00228 
00229     extern void  OrderSVD ( int M, int N, rmatrix U, rmatrix V,
00230                             rvector W, bool MatU, bool MatV );
00231 
00232 
00233   }
